title: Riot's treatment of Malzahar is ruining the game for me
body: Nobody from Riot will talk about Malzahar. The balance team keeps throwing nerfs at his support disregarding how it will effect his midlane. All the feedback from both myself and all the others who played him pre rework is ignored. When I play him I can't even relax or have fun anymore when i play him because i get too pissed off and depressed about this whole thing. I have other champions I can play. Bard, Taliyah, Swain, Illaoi, Nocturne, but none of them will ever be what Malzahar was for me a year ago. And why bother getting invested in another champion when Riot can just come along and do the same thing again? Because of how new champions are being designed, there will never be another Malzahar. It doesnt matter how many times we say the rework failed, it should be reverted, it feels like shit to play etc because Riot doesn't care. They don't read threads about Malzahar, they don't read tweets about him or questions on Ask Riot about him. And they probably never will

Of course i'm not saying they spend 1.6 billion on only balancing champions, but we aren't talking about rocket science here, and the cost to actually balance the game is a drop in the bucket compared to server costs. Although now that i look it up spaceX costs to launch into low earth orbit are around 56.5 Million, So if they wanted to Riot could launch an astronautilus figure into space without making a dent in their budget. Step 1: If a rework fails and makes the champion worse than before do a full revert, no questions asked.

With that change alone you drastically improve several champs now and lay the groundwork to not fuck champions up in the future.

First of all, no, the correct answer is rework them again.  They were broken before, that's why you reworked them, so going back to that would be bad.

Second, has that ever actually happened?  Even Morde, as much as there is to complain about him, is better than he was.  Skarner's "failed" in the sense of going from basically nobody playing him to... basically nobody playing him, but I don't know if you can say it actually made him *worse*.

The full reworks like Sion, Yorick and Poppy have all been huge improvements. (Admittedly they were starting from the worst champions in the game, because those are the ones Riot targeted for full reworks.)

Never said balancing all the champs was easy, I would expect them to screw up from time to time.
What isn't ok is screwing up, then ignoring it like it isn't a problem.

Because constantly going backwards whenever the fanbase gets upset isn't the right move. Adapting and moving on from what you changed is. The worst thing Riot ever did is revert Kog'Maw, because now every given rework that anyone ever complains about is going to have people asking to put the champion back to how they used to be.

Kog was reverted because the little guy basically warped the entire game around him. No other rework has come close to that. Riot will rework Malz again, hopefully with changes to his voidlings, and they'll presumably try to make Malz less disgusting.

to be honest old malzahar was much eaiser to deal with for assassins. immediately after rework his passive made him so fucking hard to kill until they nerfed it.
I honestly must have skipped out on this kog'maw phase, I vaguely remember it. Why was it so bad? How was he so OP?

There is a strategy called "Juggermaw", also known as "protect the Kog'maw". This startegy required your whole team to pick champions to protect Kog, transforming him into a Ranged Juggernaut. Lulu top, Orianna Mid, Janna support and Gragas jungle as an example of a Juggermaw Team Comp.

This strategy has existed before his rework, showing how powerful one champion can be with a Team built around him.

Kog'Maw's Rework has increased his Damage Extremely at the cost of needing more items to scale. This led to some extremely binary duels (and teamfights) where you had to burst him fast or die in case he got his items, or ignore him... Your whole team had to focus him or you would be melted by Runaan' plus all his on-hit effects at 5 attacks per second in late-game.

Reworked Kog could kill entire teams by standing still and AA-ing anyone who came to him. All he needed were items. In combination with the "Juggermaw" comp, he was both the bait and the killer. And the bait also survived...

The main thing that you have to understand is that Reworked Kog was a feast or famine kind of champion, that was reliable only in a "Juggermaw" comp. People hate to rely on their team, people hate Hyperscaling champions, and, most importantly, people hate stat-checks. Reworked Kog had all of these problems.

Are you **joking**? 

Old Malzahar had a very telegraphed lane pushing pattern of "bouncing" his visions around to farm and harass enemies. His kill combo involved getting W-E-R-Passive Minion on a target which required some execution-related skills as it wasn't the easiest thing to do on an opponent aware of the threat. There was a very precise window of opportunity where Malzahar could align all these elements together to make something happen. 

New Malzahar combines the worst mechanics of old Yorick (spammable minions that deal way too much damage if ignored, feel very uninteractive by the Malzahar player or his opponent) and tacked on one of the most unbalanced passives in the game. Honestly, that passive would be broken on almost any champion - that's how stupid it is - and those elements sapped so much power budget out of Malzahar's kit that any skill expression in his old iteration is basically gone. 

Malzahar was undeniably healthier in his old iteration and far more fun to play. I refuse to believe a full revert isn't a possibility in his case as his new kit is frankly embarrassing.

They basically just removed AD malzahar, while putting all of malzahar's burst onto the most inconsistent and player disconnected ability they've ever implemented. All the while pigeonholing players into a cast pattern of his other abilities by forcing their power into the kit's internal interactions.

{{champion:143}} went through the exact same thing back in 2013. Created as a mid-laner, popularized as a support, slammed with repeated nerfs due to support, pathetic compensation buff for mid (0.05 ratio increase on Q) mostly ignored by Riot until 2016 MYMU. 

Then reworked Zyra was nerfed and she's back in relatively the same situation and she is universally considered a support, not a mid-lane mage. 

I honestly don't see why it's so hard to just nerf base damage and increase ratios. They did it with {{champion:1}} when she was being picked throughout Season 4 as support, and it worked, she's rarely ever picked as support anymore and she's a fine pick for mid-lane.

The zyra rework did one thing wrong. Which was remove the decision making from her plants. 

The increased size of Q and the activation range of E basically just makes your plants passive/situational power. Rather than active elements which require you to pick between. Q the enemy, or double W Q for the extra ranged damage, or be greedy and try to land both?

It did another thing very wrong too, it bound a ton of her power into RNG. The difference in power between a Zyra who randomly drops 2 seeds in a good place VS one who randomly drops one unusable seed is giant and it's not like there's any substantial difference in skill inherent in this scenario. Hell, player 2 could be far better and wold still get a worse outcome than player 1.

Zyra's passive is the worst design I have seen for any ability in League's history. It's fucking abysmal and is the core reason why a Zyra revert would be a good thing.
I don't know how much Zyra's rework affected her mid lane capabilities but I definitely don't want her old passive again.
I'd take her old passive over the RNG bullshit she has now anyday.
